#Text=5. The Dynamic Taguchi Method and Neural Network for the Optimal Factors Levels Setting
#Text=To obtain the optimal parameters setting , four steps , including dynamic method and neural network , were used to achieve the research objectives .
#Text=5.1 .
#Text=STEP 1 .
#Text=Use the Orthogonal Array of the Taguchi Method to Derive the Simulation Data

#Text=This study used the orthogonal array of the Taguchi method to obtain the simulation data . Ahalt et al. used a discrete-event simulation approach to compare different EDC ’s scores in a large academic hospital in North Carolina to provide some strategies to bring better patient care outcomes . Hurwitz et al. created a flexible simulation platform to quantify the EDC ’s information , which can be used in the management of EDC . Hoot et al. developed a simulation approach for EDC to forecast the near future situation .
#Text=The forecasting results showed that the actual outcomes are near to the forecasting results .
#Text=Using simulation data to solve EDC problems has been used by an increasing number of researchers .
#Text=However , these simulation scenarios are case by case .
#Text=Hence , the selected parameters for constructing the simulation scenario must be considered based on the selected hospitals .
#Text=Furthermore , to evaluate robustness and variation in the EMS system , a signal-to-noise ( SN ) ratio was used in the system .
#Text=A higher SN value corresponds to better performance and less response variation .

#Text=Using the dynamic Taguchi method to resolve the EMS problem , the EMS formed a dynamic multi-response system including two responses , two signal levels , four control factors , and two noise factor levels .
#Text=Regarding the two responses , the response was determined by a set of signal settings , a set of control factor vectors , and a set of noise factor settings .
#Text=The response model of the EMS system could be indicated as , in which was the error term .
#Text=Hence , in the formed dynamic EMS system , denoted the i th response corresponding to the j th signal factors level .
#Text=Assuming there was no intercept in the linear ideal function , there came to , where denoted the j th signal factors level and was the slope .

#Text=To evaluate the performance in the dynamic EMS systems using the Taguchi method , the equation was applied , in which MSE was the mean square error of the distance from the measured response to the best-fitted line .
#Text=The orthogonal array , , was simulated to obtain the performance data .
#Text=Thirty-six , 2*2*9 ( 2 levels for noise factor , 2 levels for signal factors , and control factors for ) , combinations of parameter levels were simulated .
#Text=Each combination was simulated 1000 times .

#Text=The results showed that based on the performance of , the linear ideal function was , the optimal parameters setting for factors ( A , B , C , D ) was ( Level 1 , Level 1 , Level 1 , Level 1 ) and the expected result at optimum condition was 11.04 dB ( dB is a unit of measurement for SN ) .

#Text=In addition , the result showed that based on the performance of , the optimal parameters setting for factors ( A , B , C , D ) was ( Level 3 , Level 3 , Level 2 , Level 2 ) and the expected result at optimum condition was 1.01 dB .
#Text=5.2 .
#Text=STEP 2 .
#Text=Build the Relationship between Parameters and Performances
#Text=Because the time variables were a probability distribution , this study used the NN to construct a mathematical model to obtain the optimal parameters setting for the EMS .

#Text=The input nodes for the NN were the signal factor levels , noise factor levels , and control factors levels , and the output nodes for the NN were desirability values from normalized and from normalized .
#Text=The NN ’s procedure is as follows :

#Text=A soft computing algorithm , NN , has been used as a computational model in different research fields , such as medical diagnoses , financial analysis , signal processing , and pattern recognition .
#Text=Inspired by animals ’ central nervous systems , an NN was created to mimic a human biological , neurological network .
#Text=The network is formed by parallel processing units , that is , neurons or nodes .
#Text=The nodes are linked together to form a network , in which knowledge is derived through the interconnection or relationship between input and output nodes .
#Text=The weighted and transformed function is used for the weighted sum of the previous input neuronal layers , except the first layer .
#Text=Different weighted and transformed functions used in the NN meant that NNs could be used in wide-ranging applications .
#Text=Therefore , NNs create a black-box mathematical model , with a form of nonlinear mathematical network structure .
#Text=That is , if an NN ’s architecture and parameters can be adequately selected , an NN can effectively address complex nonlinear problems .
